#To view GAV loads of all families from 1 plate per pond using ggplot2
```{r}
library(tidyverse) ## Do this everytime you restart R and need it
library(ggplot2)
```

```{r}
top10fams <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/cheryltky/ViralTransmission/master/Working%20Files/allcohorts_1plate_top10fams.csv")
head(top10fams)
summary(top10fams)
str(top10fams)
```

#make FamID a factor

```{r}
top10fams $IntFamID <- as.factor(top10fams $IntFamID)
summary(top10fams)
```

##Scatterplot by families
```{r}
ggplot(top10fams , aes(IntFamID , GAV)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_classic()
```

##boxplot by families
```{r}
ggplot(top10fams , aes(IntFamID , GAV)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2) +
  aes(color = Class , shape = Class ) +
  labs( title = "All families GAV loads")

top10famplot <- ggplot(top10fams , aes(IntFamID , GAV)) +
  geom_jitter(width = 0.2) +
  aes(color = Class , shape = Class ) +
  labs( title = "TOp 10 Families GAV Loads",
        x = "Family" , 
        y = "GAV copies/ug TNA")


ggsave("top10famplots.png" , top10famplot , width = 15, height = 10 , dpi = 300)
```


```{r Make make offspring ID , father ID, Mother ID and cohort all factors too} 
top10fams $AnimalID <- as.factor(top10fams$AnimalID)
top10fams$Cohort <- as.factor(top10fams$Cohort)
top10fams$Type <- as.factor(top10fams$Type)
top10fams$Class <- as.factor(top10fams$Class)
top10fams$Code <- as.factor(top10fams$Code)
summary(top10fams)
```
